query: Test sensitivity of datacenter UPS adoption to key parameters: discount rate (6% vs 8% vs 10%), Li-ion lifespan (10yr vs 12yr vs 15yr), and S-curve ceiling (90% vs 95% vs 99%). Show how each affects tipping point and final adoption for Global forecast
expected_behavior: Step 1: Runs baseline forecast (8% discount, 12yr lifespan, 95% ceiling)
Step 2: Runs discount rate sensitivity (6% and 10% variants)
Step 3: Runs lifespan sensitivity (10yr and 15yr variants)
Step 4: Runs ceiling sensitivity (90% and 99% variants)
Step 5: Uses adoption_model.py to analyze parameter impacts
Step 6: Generates sensitivity analysis report with parameter sweep results
Discount rate sensitivity: Lower rate (6%) → earlier tipping by ~1-2 years (OpEx savings more valuable)
Discount rate sensitivity: Higher rate (10%) → later tipping by ~1-2 years (upfront costs matter more)
Lifespan sensitivity: Extended life (15yr) → TCO improves by ~15%, tipping advances ~2 years
Lifespan sensitivity: Shorter life (10yr) → TCO worsens, tipping delays ~1-2 years
Ceiling sensitivity: Higher ceiling (99%) → more complete transition, only 1% residual VRLA niche
Ceiling sensitivity: Lower ceiling (90%) → 10% permanent VRLA market (legacy, low-criticality sites)
Shows that tipping point most sensitive to cost trajectories, moderately to lifespan
Final adoption most sensitive to ceiling parameter and lifespan (replacement cycle effects)
Generates tornado chart or parameter sensitivity table
All sensitivity runs maintain mass balance and non-negativity constraints
Demonstrates that parameter uncertainty creates ±3 year range in tipping point estimates
Shows adoption range of 78-92% by 2040 across reasonable parameter bounds
